Class EpicLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • EpicLibrary

  •  class EpicLibrary
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of useful methods.
    Author:
    Jonny Daenen

      • getRandom

        public static int getRandom(int a,
            int b)
        Generates a random number in the closed interval [a, b].
        Parameters:
        a - The lowest number that can be generated.
        b - The highest number that can be generated (at least a).
        Returns:
        a random number in the closed interval [a, b].

      • generateBoolTable

        public static boolean[][] generateBoolTable(int rows,
                            int cols,
                            int numTrue)
        Generates a 2D boolean matrix of given dimensions, filled with a given number of true values on random places. The number of true values must be lower than or equal to rows*cols.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows.
        cols - The number of columns.
        numTrue - The number of values that should be set to true.
        Returns:
        a random boolean matrix of specified dimensions.

      • convertBool2D1D

        public static boolean[] convertBool2D1D(boolean[][] t)
        Converts a 2D table into a 1D table. All rows are pasted behind each other.
        Parameters:
        t - An arbitrary boolean table.
        Returns:
        the 1D version of the given table.

      • calculateSize

        public static int calculateSize(boolean[][] t)
        Calculates the number of cells in a given table of any shape.
        Parameters:
        t - An arbitrary boolean table.
        Returns:
        the number of cells in the table.

      • shuffle2D

        public static void shuffle2D(boolean[][] t)
        Shuffles a 2D table according to the Fisher-Yates algorithm. The table itself is shuffled.
        Parameters:
        t - An arbitrary 2D boolean table.

      • shuffle1D

        public static void shuffle1D(boolean[] t)
        Shuffles a 1D table according to the Fisher-Yates algorithm. The table itself is shuffled.
        Parameters:
        t - An arbitrary 1D boolean table.

      • countTrue

        public static int countTrue(boolean[][] t)
        Counts the number of true values appearing in an arbitrary 2D boolean table.
        Parameters:
        t - An arbitrary 2D boolean table.
        Returns:
        the number of true values in the table.

      • countFalse

        public static int countFalse(boolean[][] t)
        Counts the number of false values appearing in an arbitrary 2D boolean table.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the number of false values in the table.

      • boolNot

        public static boolean[][] boolNot(boolean[][] t)
        Creates a copy of the given boolean table and applies logical negation to all its cells.
        Parameters:
        t - An arbitrary 2D boolean table.
        Returns:
        a copy of the table, where the cells are negated.

      • boolAnd

        public static boolean[][] boolAnd(boolean[][] t1,
                  boolean[][] t2)
        Creates a 2D boolean table, based on 2 given 2D boolean tables. Each cell position appearing in one of the given tables appears in the result. The value of this cell is determined by the logical and, applied to the values on the corresponding cells in the 2 tables. When one of these cells does not exist, the non-existing cell is assumed to be false.
        Parameters:
        t1 - An arbitrary 2D boolean table.
        t2 - An arbitrary 2D boolean table.
        Returns:
        the supermatrix, obtained by applying the and-operation.

      • boolOr

        public static boolean[][] boolOr(boolean[][] t1,
                 boolean[][] t2)
        Creates a 2D boolean table, based on 2 given 2D boolean tables. Each cell position appearing in one of the given tables appears in the result. The value of this cell is determined by the logical or, applied to the values on the corresponding cells in the 2 tables. When one of these cells does not exist, the non-existing cell is assumed to be false.
        Parameters:
        t1 - An arbitrary 2D boolean table.
        t2 - An arbitrary 2D boolean table.
        Returns:
        the supermatrix, obtained by applying the or-operation.

      • createSuperMatrix

        public static boolean[][] createSuperMatrix(boolean[][] t1,
                            boolean[][] t2)
        Calculates a supermatrix of 2 input tables, with all cells initialized to false. The number of rows of this matrix is equal to the maximum number of rows of both tables. Each row contains a number of cells equal to the maximum of cells both tables have in that row (if it exists).
        Parameters:
        t1 - An arbitrary 2D boolean table.
        t2 - An arbitrary 2D boolean table.
        Returns:
        the supermatrix, with all cells set to false.

      • findNumbers

        public static int[] findNumbers(java.lang.String input)
        Extracts a list of decimal numbers from a given input string. Number are separated by at least 1 non-digit.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string.
        Returns:
        the list of numbers appearing in the string.

      • inBounds

        public static boolean inBounds(boolean[][] table,
               int i,
               int j)
        Checks whether a cell exists in a table.
        Parameters:
        table - Table in which to check the existance of a cell.
        i - The row index.
        j - The column index.
        Returns:
        true if cell (i,j) exists; false otherwise.
